programme.desc: Desperate to get to bedrock and large quantities of gold, Todd and Jack throw caution to the wind and dig deeper than ever before. With the brutal Alaskan winter threatening, they battle floods, cave-ins and equipment breakdowns.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: With the arctic winter looming, the crew races against the clock. Rain and thawing snow flood the mine and Jack puts his life on the line as the glory hole caves in around the massive 100,000 pound excavator.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: Six recession-hit patriots from Oregon become greenhorn old miners and head to Alaska to dig for gold in hopes of striking it big to save themselves from financial ruin.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The greenhorn miners are at risk when a mechanical accident threatens to close mining season.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The crew races to set up the mining plant and start running dirt. When the families arrive from Oregon and question the lack of gold and the men's only mechanic becomes dangerously ill, the tension builds so high Dorsey and Todd come to blows.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The team attempts to finally run potential pay dirt through the wash plant, but a visit from the Department of Fish and Game reveals a violation, jeopardizing their vital water supply to the mine.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The miners continue to run dirt but an equipment malfunction brings the operation to a halt. James Harness collapses and Jimmy Dorsey drives a wedge between himself and the crew when he takes on an extra job to earn cash.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: With winter weather closing in, a gold recovery expert comes to help the rookies. Todd discovers a major design flaw in the equipment and is forced to make huge modifications.

programme.title: Yeti or Not
programme.desc: Dr. Mark Evans, a veterinarian and explorer, is on a mission to sift fact from folklore and distil the plausible from the possible as he searches for a rational explanation for the mysterious Himalayan biped known as the Yeti.

programme.title: Secrets in the Ice
programme.desc: A frozen lake deep in the Himalayas melts once a year to expose hundreds of human bones and a centuries-old mystery of astonishing carnage, leaving experts to speculate if it was a single catastrophic event or something much more sinister.

programme.title: Secrets in the Ice
programme.desc: Three graves are discovered on the frozen beach of an uninhabited Arctic island, and the mummified corpses inside may answer a centuries-old mystery of an expedition that was literally consumed by the cannibalistic insanity of its mutinous crew.

programme.title: Secrets in the Ice
programme.desc: After a 2,500-year-old mummy is discovered in Siberia, locals report strange, cataclysmic events that point to an ancient curse; using cutting-edge archaeology, experts reveal who this person was and if they've unleashed something sinister.

programme.title: Secrets in the Ice
programme.desc: A top-secret military base hidden deep in the ice beyond the Arctic Circle is one of the Cold War's most elaborate cover-ups, and recently declassified documents reveal its deadly purpose, and the threat it might still pose to all humankind.

programme.title: Secrets in the Ice
programme.desc: When strange towers of ice are found growing from in a barren, water-starved desert, experts speculate why these structures have uncanny similarities to extraterrestrial formations recently discovered on Pluto's alien landscape.

programme.title: Secrets in the Ice
programme.desc: Experts make a chilling new discovery when they unearth a 30,000-year-old zombie virus from an icy grave. If this ancient disease is successfully resuscitated back to life, it could cause a catastrophic global calamity.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Investigating the deadly bullshark, which isn't limited to the world's oceans.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade travels to the Congo in search of the world's most ferocious fish.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade sets out to discover the true river monster of South America.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade travels to the Paran River in the remote corner of Argentina to investigate the death of a young girl. This creature is not armed with bone crunching jaws or razor sharp teeth, but a razor-sharp blade tipped with tissue destroying venom.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Tales of a body-snatching spirit called the Water Mama have reached Jeremy. With people disappearing without a trace, Jeremy is convinced there is a real river monster lurking behind the legend.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy returns to Africa's Okavango Delta to investigate a pack-hunting carnivore blamed for mauling the victims of a capsized boat. This time, he decides to put on his dive gear and offer himself as live bait in croc-infested waters.

programme.title: River Monsters: Mysteries of the Ocean
programme.desc: Something is terrorizing the Florida Keys, attacking both visitors and locals alike - striking its victims so violently it is slicing open flesh, even smashing bones. Jeremy Wade is determined to identity the assailant, but is quickly out of his depth.

programme.title: River Monsters: Deadliest Man-Eaters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade heads to Nepal to investigate a lone fisherman dragged into a river by a goonch catfish. In Indonesia, Jeremy comes face-to-face with a mysterious sea creature that has been killing local fishermen and tourists.

programme.title: Big Cat Tales
programme.desc: Clashing elephants force the Marsh pride to take cover. Fig the leopard continues to give vital lessons for young cub. The Marsh pride females are threatened by unknown nomadic males. Amani the cheetah battles a hyena over food.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: The ingenuity of zoo staff is put to the test as they devise a treatment for a newborn snow leopard cub struggling to walk and a group of surprisingly adorable Rodrigues fruit bats are trained for a big move.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: The last polar bear in NYC is showing his age, so staff make sure he gets all the attention he needs. Also, a trio of red ruffed lemurs prepare for their debut and a new exhibit is constructed for the hellbender, a giant amphibian with a bad reputation.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: The brown bears keep tearing up their exhibit, leaving zoo staff scrambling for a solution. Armani the aardvark gets treated for a tooth infection which has dampened her enthusiasm for digging. And, a group of burrowing owls prepare to move.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Dave, a kangaroo suffering from chronic arthritis, tries cryotherapy. A large group of rambunctious gharials are trained to patiently wait for their food. And, a tiny pygmy marmoset gives birth to an even tinier baby.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: The slow loris has a tiny window for breeding, so staff anxiously help a potential pair connect. The veterinary team develop ground-breaking techniques to treat the stoic pigeons and an okapi with a limp gets a helping hand.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: The staff is hopeful for a successful breeding season when Mshango the giraffe meets the females of the herd. Power tools are needed for an Amur tiger's root canal, while Louie the swan falls ill, jeopardizing his release.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: It's a series of firsts when the Central Park Zoo welcomes its first-ever Atlantic puffin chick. A rhino called Penny undergoes a series of allergy tests, while an endangered species of gecko welcomes her first hatchling.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A trio of abandoned puma cubs arrives at the zoo, while the staff grows concerned that Ella, the oldest rhino, is not acting herself. Meanwhile, a Caribbean flamingo is born at the zoo after nearly two decades, and Otto the stallion makes his debut.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: The zoo opens an endangered turtle species facility, while Malayan tigers Suhanna and Rimba struggle to breed, because Rimba seems disinterested. Needles the porcupine gets a new mate, and the Guar herd eagerly await the arrival of new calves.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Seven "Little Blues" join the penguin exhibit and are quick to mingle with the rest of the colony. When a honey-loving grizzly slows her step, the staff grows concerned. A turtle can't seem to get along with the alligators, and a nyala calf is born.

programme.title: Mega Zoo
programme.desc: Problems arise when beloved African wild dog Manna undergoes critical surgery. Treatment is needed for an elderly croc's ruptured cornea, and Jose and Kristie give pygmy hippo Felix the VIP treatment.

programme.title: Mega Zoo
programme.desc: The vet team must find a solution when mama baboon Qetesh's baby struggles with separation anxiety. Beloved seal Tarwin gives keeper Jose a big scare, and keeper Mark steps in as a surrogate for beautiful little Betsy.

programme.title: Mega Zoo
programme.desc: The games begin for keepers when orangutan Malu destroys his playroom. An elderly horse must undergo a risky procedure, and keepers must decide if it's time to say goodbye to one of the zoo's most beloved giraffes.

programme.title: Mega Zoo
programme.desc: A routine health check takes a frightening turn for lion brothers Lwazi and Ato. Keepers anxiously await to see if otter couple Odie and Paula are expecting, and a gorilla called Kanzi must prove she can receive vital medical care.

programme.title: Mega Zoo
programme.desc: A team races to save a wombat named Daisy suffering from mysterious health issues before it's too late. Keepers Georgie and Luke venture on a challenging road trip to transport a giraffe calf, and a secret hidden underneath the Melbourne Zoo is revealed.

programme.title: Mega Zoo
programme.desc: Keepers become concerned when the big move for lion brothers Lwazi and Ato is delayed. Young rhino Kifaru is challenged during a mating ritual, and a brilliant plan saves the endangered mountain pygmy possums.

programme.title: Mega Zoo
programme.desc: In the savannah, Dr. Bonnie must perform a critical surgery on zebra Zaide's badly damaged tail. Tiger Indrah gets an incredible tenth birthday surprise, and Dr. Sarah is determined to solve spider monkey Isobella's medical mystery.

programme.title: Mega Zoo
programme.desc: In order to navigate the COVID-19 global pandemic, the staff must ensure proper care for their animals. Keepers spring into action when urgent dental surgery is needed for elderly tiger Binjai, and a family of cotton top tamarin monkeys must be relocated.

programme.title: Junkyard Empire

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Corvette enthusiast brings in his 1963 Corvette, and wants a huge LS X engine, a larger transmission, he wants to ditch the side pipes, and developing a one-of-a-kind, stand-out paint color.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: The guys are working on two vehicles today. First, they level out a nose-heavy GMC 1500 and add some get-up-and-go, too. Then they take on a Mazda 3's groaning wheel bearing with the help of some time-saving tools every mechanic will want in their shop.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: A Mustang was once a father-son project, but the project stalled and now the car hasn't run in 20 years. The guys systematically go through everything that needs to be fixed, and hopefully, they'll get this pony running again.

programme.title: Roadkill Classics
programme.desc: It's a Roadkill challenge like no other. David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan are joined by Motor Trend originals' hosts for an all-out war on tires on this episode of Roadkill powered by Dodge.

programme.title: Roadkill Classics
programme.desc: The rear-engine, 455 Oldsmobile powered Mazdarati mini-truck is back! Freiburger and Finnegan couldn't run it into the 10s on the dragstrip, even though the previous owner claimed it would, so now they're throwing even more at the little truck.

programme.title: Roadkill Classics
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan have found the world's only C-Body Road Runner, a bent-up, crescent-shaped B-Body that had an unfortunate encounter with a light pole. They decide they can't let it rot in a junkyard, and bring it to the shop.

programme.title: Roadkill Classics
programme.desc: The Vanishing Paint Challenger is back! With an upgraded suspension, it's ready to dominate the autocross. David and Steve enter it in the Tire Rack SCCA Solo Nationals in Lincoln, Nebraska, a mere 1,700 miles away.

programme.title: Roadkill Classics
programme.desc: David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan buy a car sight unseen to take a big adventure. It turns out to be a 1966 Ford Econoline flat-face pickup with a lot of rust, a worn-out 289 V-8, a full-'70s stance and no hood.

programme.title: Roadkill Classics
programme.desc: Celebrate Father's Day with this special extra episode of Roadkill powered by Dodge. There's big action as David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan scheme some chaos in hot-rodded pickups. They invite Steve Dulcich from Roadkill Garage as well as Lucky Costa.

programme.title: Roadkill Classics
programme.desc: Witness the epic return of the Roadkill Draguar on a journey from the Roadkill Nights event on Woodward Avenue in Michigan all the way to racing at the NHRA Nationals in Minnesota.

programme.title: Roadkill Classics
programme.desc: Finnegan's loved Chargers since he was a kid, and recently bought a long-abandoned '68 Dodge Charger that's lasted 48 years in as-built condition. Finnegan now works with buddies Tony, David, and Daniel to bring it back to life.

programme.title: Roadkill Classics
programme.desc: The Roadkill crew take a 50-year-old car to the 14,115-foot summit of Pikes Peak in Colorado.

programme.desc: MBCs' latest client loves her trucks, particularly the 1950 Chevy. But with a list of customizations the size of Texas, this build is going to seriously test Joe's mechanical genius.

programme.desc: David is a Volkswagen fanatic who wants to outmatch muscle cars with a 1967 Beetle. FantomWorks will have to undo the bad repairs from at least three fiberglass rending accidents to give Robert the widened 1967 Corvette supercar he wants.

programme.desc: Fred and Dave see if an old 2003 Chevy Avalanche can run 21 Road in Western Colorado.

programme.desc: Steve examines a '62 Gran Turismo Hawk, a '53 Starliner, a '58 President Starlight Hardtop and more.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: Focuses on the customizing of different vehicles, as well as some wild test-drives.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Doug is undeniably upset when he's accused of setting his '55 Ford Thunderbird on fire to collect insurance money. When he finds out his car his on its way to the Overhaulin' shop, he sings a different tune.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: David and Steve attack a Jeep Scrambler that's been in the Freiburger fleet for about 20 years. They pull it out of hiding, spiff up some mechanical glitches, and head out for some hard-core rock-crawling adventures.

programme.desc: Dennis takes in the Hagley Museum Car Show in Wilmington, Delaware and learns about window felts and run channel.

programme.title: Lokar Car Show

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage
programme.desc: Tony Angelo and Lucky Costa get a vehicle back in action with a complete QA1 suspension system, and fire up 326 with the new Holley Terminator Stealth EFI system.

programme.desc: Wayne is in Virginia to help sell two roadsters, an impeccable '58 AC Ace Bristol fresh from an eight-year restoration and a coveted Series 1 '67 Jaguar XKE. In California, a '68 Toyota Corona makes an unforgettable impression.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Bumpus and Fuller explain how to prep your next paint project for the booth.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Four gears are better than two, so the crew takes the old two-speed Powerglide out of a '67 Chevy Camaro and installs a Muncie four speed. Along the way, they'll show off all of the parts needed for the swap.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Work is almost complete on the FourWheeler Shop Truck as Ian finds the perfect service bed for it.

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage

programme.title: Truck U

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: The owner of a 2003 GMC Yukon wants to add a lot of horses to this grocery getter. The guys take over the project and install a turbo and fuel lines, then add rear-end components to help keep that newly-added power on the pavement.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike and Ant are bringing to auction a highly desirable 1965 Austin-Healey 3000 MkIII. Will a custom exhaust, Weber carbs, and a sparkling new interior be enough to earn top dollar from the most discriminating car buyers on earth.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike taps the growing custom van market by picking up an extremely distressed 1965 Dodge A-100 Sportsman. A swapped drivetrain, state of the art suspension and custom-built surf inspired details provide enough wow-factor to snag a buyer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
